predicate.note: Frames file for 'nose-dive' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry, no Framenet entry. Comparison with 'fall'.

roleset.name: fall very fast

role.descr: end point, end state, often PRD

example.name: another verb of quantifiable motion, you know the drill
example.text: Compaq Computer nose-dived $8.625 a share, to $100, and pulled other technology issues lower after reporting lower-than-expected earnings after the stock market closed Wednesday.

roleset.note: Note that "nose-dived" is a confirmation of the lexicalist hypothesis and Blocking--most people would say the past tense of "dived" is "dove", but "nose-dive" is apparently no longer associated with "dive" and thus does not take the irregular past tense. Cool.
